timeAnchors.definition: Day 1 of induction phase; pre-randomization/prior to the first intranasal dose
timeAnchors.sourceText: Stable response: 50% reduction in the MADRS total score from baseline (Day 1 of induction phase; pre-randomization/prior to the first intranasal dose)

repetitions.sourceText: Repeated Doses at Intervals Determined by Symptom Severity

executionTypes.rationale: Screening phase activities are performed once to determine study eligibility.
Repeated doses of intranasal esketamine administered at scheduled intervals during the induction phase.
Scheduled repeats of assessments at visits during the optimization phase.
Dosing intervals are determined by symptom severity, implying a conditional workflow based on clinical decision points.
Assessments performed at scheduled intervals following the completion of treatment.
A one-time assessment triggered only if a subject terminates the study early.

footnoteConditions.text: a) An additional, optional period of up to 3 weeks is permitted to taper and discontinue all current medication(s) being used for depression after completion of the Week 4 (Visit 1.3) assessments.

footnoteConditions.text: g) Postdose vital signs will be performed at t = +40 minutes, 1 hour, and 1.5 hours postdose.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: g) Postdose vital signs will be performed at t = +40 minutes, 1 hour, and 1.5 hours postdose.

footnoteConditions.text: h) The 12-lead electrocardiogram will be performed at 1 hour postdose.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: h) The 12-lead electrocardiogram will be performed at 1 hour postdose.

footnoteConditions.text: i) The MOAA/S will be performed every 15 minutes from predose to t = 1.5 hours postdose.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: i) The MOAA/S will be performed every 15 minutes from predose to t = 1.5 hours postdose.

footnoteConditions.text: j) The BPRS+ and CADSS will be performed predose and at 40 minutes and 1.5 hours postdose.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: j) The BPRS+ and CADSS will be performed predose and at 40 minutes and 1.5 hours postdose.

footnoteConditions.text: k) CGADR will be performed at 1 hour and 1.5 hours postdose.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: k) CGADR will be performed at 1 hour and 1.5 hours postdose.

footnoteConditions.text: l) The nasal symptom questionnaire will be performed predose and at 1 hour postdose.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: l) The nasal symptom questionnaire will be performed predose and at 1 hour postdose.

footnoteConditions.text: m) Blood samples should be collected prior to dosing.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: m) Blood samples should be collected prior to dosing.

footnoteConditions.text: o) Only applicable to women with a menstrual cycle.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Time to Relapse (Stable Remission)

timeWindow.duration: Maintenance Phase until first relapse event

endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Delaying the time to first documentation of relapse compared to active comparator
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: The primary efficacy endpoint includes only subjects who are in stable remission at the end of the optimization phase... and is defined as the time between subject randomization and the first document

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Time to Relapse (Stable Response)

timeWindow.duration: Maintenance Phase until first relapse event

endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Delaying the time to first documentation of relapse in subjects with stable response (not in remission)
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: The time between subject randomization and the first documentation (earliest date) of a relapse in the maintenance phase for subjects with stable response (not in remission) at the end of the optimiza

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Change from Baseline in Depressive Symptoms
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Reduction in MADRS and PHQ-9 scores
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: The change from baseline (of maintenance phase) to endpoint in: Depressive symptoms, using the MADRS and the self-reported Patient Health Questionnaire 9-item (PHQ-9) scale

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Change from Baseline in Severity of Illness
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: The change from baseline (of maintenance phase) to endpoint in: Overall severity of illness, using the Clinical Global Impression - Severity (CGI-S)

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Change from Baseline in Anxiety Symptoms
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: The change from baseline (of maintenance phase) to endpoint in: Symptoms of anxiety, using the Generalized Anxiety Disorder, 7-item (GAD-7) scale

derivedVariables.name: Time to Relapse
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Randomization date (after stable remission at end of optimization phase)

derivedVariables.name: Stable Remission
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Determined at the end of the optimization phase after treatment with intranasal esketamine plus an oral antidepressant

transitions.trigger: Progress to Open Label Induction Phase

dosingRegimens.titrationSchedule: Optimization phase used to determine dose and frequency.
Varies by specific antidepressant selected (Escitalopram, Sertraline, Duloxetine, or Venlafaxine XR).

An additional UPSIT assessment was added to Week 20 (Visit 4.5). Rationale: Flexibility was needed for decongestants versus delay for a subject with congestion on an intranasal dosing day.
Week 20, Visit 4.5 (Day 137). Timing of various procedures and assessments were revised accordingly to be performed at Week 20 visit. Subsequent visits now start with Visit 4.6 (Week 21).
